issue.title: Cargo crates generated from git repositories are not reproducible
issue.body:
If you have a crate loaded from git in your Cargo.toml, this gets loaded by bazel via git_repository. This leaves the .git directory  [either in the root or in `.tmp_git_root`](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/0d672f3495036ca9e35a8fcd821fd4df6461b7dc/tools/build_defs/repo/git.bzl#L31-L36). The .git directory contains files where the contents is not a function of the input attributes to `git_repository`, so technically this repository rule is not reproducible (see https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/18152). Rules_rust [generates globs that depend on these files](https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_rust/blob/d787525049e4cbaadabb2f531fe86c871a6cf505/examples/crate_universe/vendor_external/crates/BUILD.heck-0.4.0.bazel#L23-L32), making these rules unnecessarily re-run when the repository rule is re-run.

We should probably exclude `.git` from these globs.

body: Does it not remove it here https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/0d672f3495036ca9e35a8fcd821fd4df6461b7dc/tools/build_defs/repo/git.bzl#L176 ðŸ¤”

I guess this bug only happens when `strip_prefix` is specified, and the git repository is in `.tmp_git_root`. I didn't observe the other case, and just assumed. I think the line above needs to be changed to:

```
if ctx.attr.strip_prefix:
    ctx.delete(ctx.path(".tmp_git_root"))
else:
    ctx.delete(ctx.path(".git"))
```
@cameron-martin That looks very reasonable. Do you want to submit that as a PR?

issue.title: Delete .git directory from git_repository external repositories when using strip_prefix

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Leaving the `.git` directory in an external repository makes the rule not reproducible since this directory contains timestamps of when the fetch occurred. When strip_prefix is not specified, this directory is correctly cleaned up but not when strip_prefix is specified, since the `.git` directory lives in `.tmp_git_root`.

Note that we cannot delete the whole `.tmp_git_root` directory, since the items in the root are symlinks to here.

Fixes #18152.
